original: Järpe, Sven Eric Valdemar, överläkare, Ulricehamn, f. 21/9/00 i Halmstad. G. 30 m. Ingeborg (Bollan) Cer-vin. Barn: Sven f. 34, Karin 38, Anna 42. — Studiex. i Halmstad 20, med. kand. i Lund 25, med. lic. 30. Stud:-res. i Österr. 31, Danm. 32, Tyskl. 37, Norge 39. Und :läk. v. Allm. sjukh. i Malmö med. avd. 30-37, överläk. v. Ulricehamns sanat. sed. 37. Led. av styr. f. A-B Ulricehamns Sanat. o. Badanst. sed. 40 o. Älvsb. 1. sjukhem sed. 39, ordf. i Ulricehamnsbygdens jaktskyttekl. sed. 41. Skr.: smärre med. upps. i facktidskr. Hobbies: jakt o. fiske. *Jönsson, Arthur Edvin, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 29/3/03 i Osby, Krist. 1. — Stud:ex. i Lund 22, fil. mag. v. Lunds univ. 28, provår v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg 37. Timlär. v. Osby samsk. 27-30, e. o. ämneslär. i Säter 31, e. o. adj. v. Majornas h. a. 1 i Gbg 38, adj. i matem. o. kemi v. östra real i Gbg fr. 47.
translated:
Järpe, Sven Eric Valdemar, chief physician, Ulricehamn, born September 21, 1900 in Halmstad. Married in 1930 to Ingeborg (Bollan) Cervin. Children: Sven born 1934, Karin born 1938, Anna born 1942. He finished his high school studies in Halmstad in 1920 and received his Bachelor of Medicine from Lund University in 1925. He earned his medical license in 1930 and went on study trips to Austria in 1931, Denmark in 1932, Germany in 1937, and Norway in 1939. He was an assistant physician at the General Hospital in Malmö from 1930 to 1937 and became a chief physician at Ulricehamns Sanatorium in 1937. He was on the board of A-B Ulricehamns Sanatorium and Bathing Establishment from 1940 and the Älvsborg First Aid Center from 1939. He was the chairman of the Ulricehamn Shooting Club from 1941. His written works include minor medical papers published in professional journals. His hobbies were hunting and fishing. 

Jönsson, Arthur Edvin, high school teacher, Gothenburg, born March 29, 1903 in Osby, Kristianstad County. He completed his high school studies in Lund in 1922 and received a Bachelor of Arts degree from Lund University in 1928. He underwent a probationary period at Vasa School in Gothenburg in 1937. He was a part-time teacher at Osby samskola from 1927 to 1930, an acting subject teacher in Säter in 1931, an acting high school teacher at Majorna School in Gothenburg in 1938, and a mathematics and chemistry teacher at Östra Real School in Gothenburg from 1947.

structured.name: Sven Eric Valdemar Järpe
structured.description: Sven Eric Valdemar Järpe was a Swedish physician, born on September 21, 1900 in Halmstad. He completed his high school studies in Halmstad, received his Bachelor of Medicine from Lund University, and earned his medical license. He was an assistant physician at the General Hospital in Malmö and became a chief physician at Ulricehamns Sanatorium. He was on the board of A-B Ulricehamns Sanatorium and Bathing Establishment and the Älvsborg First Aid Center. He was the chairman of the Ulricehamn Shooting Club. His hobbies were hunting and fishing.
